description: Farmstead and Roman Villa ranging from the 1st C BCE to the 5th C CE. During the later Roman villa phase (CE 300 - 450) features were added including a building which has been identified as a temple-mausoleum.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Keston (Kent).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Philp, Parfitt, Willson, Dutto, and Williams. “The Roman Villa Site at Keston, Kent” 1 (1991).
